data.title: Frisch, Karl von (1886
data.meta_description: Karl von Frisch was an Austrian zoologist best known for his studies of bee behavior, perception, and communication.
data.text: Karl von Frisch was an Austrian zoologist best known for his studies of bee behavior, perception, and communication, discovering the "Dance of the Bees." With Konrad Lorenz and Nikolaas Tinbergen he was awarded the 1973 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for his work. See also insect senses.
